intro: Aulomyrcia biformis, commonly known as the two-form aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
